noun.description: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; moral uprightness.
examples: he is known to be a man of integrity

noun.description: The state of being whole and undivided.
examples: upholding territorial integrity and national sovereignty

origin: Late Middle English (in integrity (sense 2)): from French intégrité or Latin integritas, from integer intact (see integer). Compare with entirety, integral, and integrate.
